trans-unit.source: Generates a unique hardware identifier (ID) for local computer

seg-source.mrk: Generates a unique hardware identifier (ID) for local computer

target.mrk: Generates a unique hardware identifier (ID) for local computer

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: [optional] The flags that specifies what information would be used to generate ID. This parameter can be one or more of the following values.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
The flags that specifies what information would be used to generate ID.
This parameter can be one or more of the following values.

target.mrk: [optional]
The flags that specifies what information would be used to generate ID.
This parameter can be one or more of the following values.

trans-unit.source: $UHID_MB - Uses information about your motherboard. This flag is used by default regardless of whether specified or not.

seg-source.mrk: $UHID_MB - Uses information about your motherboard.
This flag is used by default regardless of whether specified or not.

target.mrk: $UHID_MB - Uses information about your motherboard.
This flag is used by default regardless of whether specified or not.

trans-unit.source: $UHID_BIOS - Uses information from BIOS.

seg-source.mrk: $UHID_BIOS - Uses information from BIOS.

target.mrk: $UHID_BIOS - Uses information from BIOS.

trans-unit.source: $UHID_CPU - Uses information about your processor(s). Note that $UHID_CPU flag reduces the function speed.

seg-source.mrk: $UHID_CPU - Uses information about your processor(s).
Note that $UHID_CPU flag reduces the function speed.

target.mrk: $UHID_CPU - Uses information about your processor(s).
Note that $UHID_CPU flag reduces the function speed.

trans-unit.source: $UHID_HDD - Uses information about the installed hard drives. Any change in the configuration disks will change ID returned by this function. Taken into account only non-removable disks with an ATA or SATA interfaces.

seg-source.mrk: $UHID_HDD - Uses information about the installed hard drives.
Any change in the configuration disks will change ID returned by this function.
Taken into account only non-removable disks with an ATA or SATA interfaces.

target.mrk: $UHID_HDD - Uses information about the installed hard drives.
Any change in the configuration disks will change ID returned by this function.
Taken into account only non-removable disks with an ATA or SATA interfaces.

trans-unit.source: $UHID_All - The sum of all the previous flags.

seg-source.mrk: $UHID_All - The sum of all the previous flags.

target.mrk: $UHID_All - The sum of all the previous flags.

trans-unit.source: Return Value

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: The string representation of the ID. @extended returns the value that contains a combination of flags

seg-source.mrk: The string representation of the ID.
@extended returns the value that contains a combination of flags

target.mrk: The string representation of the ID.
@extended returns the value that contains a combination of flags

trans-unit.source: specified in the $iFlags parameter. If flag is set, appropriate information is received successfully,

seg-source.mrk: specified in the $iFlags parameter.
If flag is set, appropriate information is received successfully,

target.mrk: specified in the $iFlags parameter.
If flag is set, appropriate information is received successfully,

trans-unit.source: otherwise fails. The function checks only flags that were specified in the $iFlags parameter.

seg-source.mrk: otherwise fails.
The function checks only flags that were specified in the $iFlags parameter.

target.mrk: otherwise fails.
The function checks only flags that were specified in the $iFlags parameter.

trans-unit.source: Empty string and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: Empty string and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

target.mrk: Empty string and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

trans-unit.source: Remarks

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: This function uses the Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI).

seg-source.mrk: This function uses the Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI).

target.mrk: This function uses the Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI).
